comments:
Using WTP 1.0 + IBM JDK 1.4.2. I created a WSDL that refers to a complex schema. When I run the wizard to generate a server skeleton, it fails with the following error message:

IWAB0399E Error in generating Java from WSDL java.io.IOException: Type {http://www.leagueplanet.org/schedule}game is referenced but not defined.

I validated the schema and it looks fine. The element <game> is defined. The wizard seems to think its a type. I'll attach the wsdl and xsd.

Created an attachment (id=34400)
WSDL file that refers to schedule schema

Created an attachment (id=34401)
Schema file for <schedule>

Created an attachment (id=34402)
Sample schedule.xml file
I modified the schema to use a type definition for the <game> element. The new type is called GameType. I'll attach it. Now the generation works.

Created an attachment (id=34405)
Modified schema with GameType - this one works.

Arthur, this looks like a bug in the Apache Axis emitters. Please open a defect in JIRA [1].

(23:26:38.61) C:\Downloads\127018 > java org.apache.axis.wsdl.WSDL2Java Query.wsdl
- Unable to find required classes (javax.activation.DataHandler and javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart). Attachment support is disabl
ed.
java.io.IOException: Type {http://www.leagueplanet.org/schedule}game is referenced but not defined.
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.symbolTable.SymbolTable.checkForUndefined(SymbolTable.java:665)
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.symbolTable.SymbolTable.add(SymbolTable.java:545)
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.symbolTable.SymbolTable.populate(SymbolTable.java:518)
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.symbolTable.SymbolTable.populate(SymbolTable.java:495)
        at org.apache.axis.wsdl.gen.Parser$WSDLRunnable.run(Parser.java:361)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

[1] http://issues.apache.org/jira
Verfied in WTP 1.5 RC6. I didn't open a JIRA. I assume this was fixed in Axis 1.3.0 which is used in WTP 1.5.

traces.message: Type {http://www.leagueplanet.org/schedule}game is referenced but not defined.
